line_1: This Truth more plainly to discover,
line_2: Suppose your Hero were a Lover.
As a fine Lady a new Lover;

line_1: Yea, could we see thee all, we should discover
line_2: Thou art one living smile all over.

line_1: Then quickly why don't you discover?
line_2: Eyes need not tell over and over

line_2: As, on Sundays, does the lover

line_2: Was, in a Pit with Thorns grown over,
Soon or late you'll hear a Lover,

line_1: No countryman living their tricks to discover;
line_2: New Lauders and Bowers the Tweed shall cross over,

line_1: If for me he can discover
